ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course to learn modern Macroeconomics. Professor Moscarini is a leading researcher, and it is great to learn from him.
PhD level course, not generally useful for non-PhD students (except perhaps those who want to do a PhD in economics later).
I would recommend this class to another student.
Good if youre interested in Macro, not otherwise.
Good introduction to macroeconomics, recommended if you're interested in the topic
This is a required course anyway but even if it were not, I'd recommend this course to my friends.
It is a very dense course on macro-economics. Highly recommended.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It was very useful in learning the foundations of modern Macroeconomics.
Very useful course. Covers fundamentals and provides tools necessary for research.
Greatly increased but I needed more intuition, I often lost the big picture in the details.
Learn useful macroeconomics models and techniques
Most of the material we covered was unfamiliar to me prior to taking the course.
Although I probably will do research in applied micro fields, I've learned a lot of tools and also some important issues in macroeconomics.
I learned a lot. But will probably not specialize in this field.
